result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Order Denying Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's oral motion to dismiss is hereby denied.  Defense counsel declined to file a written motion, stating that she did not believe any such motion would be meritorious.

ORAL MOTION TO DISMISS - 
The parties and the defendant comment.
The Court finds no violation of the defendant's right to a speedy trial or of the 6th and 14th amendments.  The oral motion to dismiss is denied.  
State to draft the order.

Court Order Appointing Stand By Counsel.
It is hereby ordered that Attorney Michael Blum be appointed to act as stand by counsel for Richard R. Rohl.  Attorney Blum will be compensated by Manitowoc County at the rate of $70.00 per hour.  The defendant will be required to repay the county when he is deemed competent by this court, at a rate of $50.00 per month.

Status conference on July 5, 2017 at 10:15 am.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion.
It is hereby ordered that the Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Information; and Motion to Collaterally Attack Prior Conviction is hereby denied.

COLLATERAL ATTACK MOTION - 
The parties argue the motion.
The court cannot find that defense counsel has made a prima facia showing and therefore, denies the motion to collaterally attack the conviction.  The transcript indicates that after the defendant voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waived his right to counsel, the court, on its' own motion, appointed stand by counsel for the defendant.
State to draft order.
Minutes.
Status conference on May 19, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing on May 9, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on March 21, 2017 at 10:15 am.
Judicial Assignment Order assigning Hon. Gary Bendix as presiding judge.

This matter was set for a collateral attack motion hearing today.
To prepare for this motion, the Court has read the transcript in 07 CF 518 of the 12-05-2007 hearing date which shows an extensive colloquy between this court and the defendant.  Given the fact this judge was part of the process for this motion, defense counsel has suggested that he recuse himself from this case.
The State takes no position.
The Court feels it is a fair request and will recuse himself from this case.  The necessary paperwork will be prepared.
Minutes.

Order Modifying Bail and Clarifying Payment Plan for Attorney Fees.
The Court orders:
1) the defendant's conditions of bail are modified as follows in this paragraph.  The defendant may operate a motor vehicle if he has a valid driver's license.  He may not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  All other terms and conditions of bail remain the same.
2) the defendant shall begin paying his court appointed counsel fees in this case at the rate of $25.00/week once he had paid all currently-outstanding fees to the Clerk of Courts.  Interest shall not accrue on any court-appointed counsel fees in this case so long as the defendant is current with all other payment plans for fees that he has through the clerk of courts and is in compliance with this order.
